DataTrack.description: DNaseHS hotspot-regions from several cell-lines (including replicates)
DataTrack.name: DNaseHS_hotspots

DataTrack.description: FAIRE (Formaldehyde Assisted Isolation of Regulatory Elements) is a method to isolate and identify nucleosome-depleted regions of the genome. FAIRE also appears to identify functional regulatory elements that include enhancers, silencers, insulators, promotors, locus control regions and novel elements.
DataTrack.name: FAIRE-seq peaks

DataTrack.name: EnsemblTranscripts
